articles.headline: Plot Twist at Turner Classic Movies Upsets Film Fans
articles.snippet: The network’s owner, Warner Bros. Discovery, promised there would be little to no change for viewers despite budget cuts behind the scenes.
articles.abstract: The network’s owner, Warner Bros. Discovery, promised there would be little to no change for viewers despite budget cuts behind the scenes.
articles.lead_paragraph: For many people in Hollywood, including lions like Steven Spielberg, Turner Classic Movies is not a cable channel. It is an extension of their identity.

articles.headline: Trump Trial Setting Could Provide Conservative Jury Pool
articles.snippet: If Judge Aileen Cannon sticks to her initial decision to hold the trial in Fort Pierce, Fla., the jury would be drawn largely from counties that Donald Trump won handily in his previous campaigns.
articles.abstract: If Judge Aileen Cannon sticks to her initial decision to hold the trial in Fort Pierce, Fla., the jury would be drawn largely from counties that Donald Trump won handily in his previous campaigns.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Judge Aileen M. Cannon assumed control of the case stemming from former President Donald J. Trump’s indictment for putting national security secrets at risk, she set the stage for the trial to be held with a regional jury pool made up mostly of counties that Mr. Trump won handily in his two previous campaigns.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Jonathan Swan and Alan Feuer

articles.headline: 3M Reaches $10.3 Billion Settlement in ‘Forever Chemicals’ Suits
articles.snippet: The deal followed an agreement by Chemours, DuPont and Corteva to pay $1.19 billion to help resolve claims that the chemical manufacturers contaminated drinking water across the country.
articles.abstract: The deal followed an agreement by Chemours, DuPont and Corteva to pay $1.19 billion to help resolve claims that the chemical manufacturers contaminated drinking water across the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: The chemical and manufacturing giant 3M reached a $10.3 billion settlement on Thursday with U.S. cities and towns over their claims that the company contaminated drinking water with so-called forever chemicals used in everything from firefighting foam to nonstick coatings.
articles.byline: By Lisa Friedman and Vivian Giang

articles.headline: Deep in the Atlantic, a ‘Catastrophic Implosion’ and Five Lives Lost
articles.snippet: The vast multinational search for the missing submersible ended after pieces of it were found on the ocean floor, 1,600 feet from the bow of the Titanic.
articles.abstract: The vast multinational search for the missing submersible ended after pieces of it were found on the ocean floor, 1,600 feet from the bow of the Titanic.
articles.lead_paragraph: A vast multinational search for five people who had descended to view the wreckage of the sunken R.M.S. Titanic ended on Thursday after pieces of the privately owned submersible vessel that had carried them were found on the ocean floor, evidence of a “catastrophic implosion” with no survivors, according to the U.S. Coast Guard.

articles.headline: How a Year Without Roe Shifted American Views on Abortion
articles.snippet: New and extensive polling shows public opinion increasingly supports legal abortion, with potential political consequences for 2024.
articles.abstract: New and extensive polling shows public opinion increasingly supports legal abortion, with potential political consequences for 2024.
articles.lead_paragraph: For decades, Americans had settled around an uneasy truce on abortion. Even if most people weren’t happy with the status quo, public opinion about the legality and morality of abortion remained relatively static. But the Supreme Court’s decision last summer overturning Roe v. Wade set off a seismic change, in one swoop striking down a federal right to abortion that had existed for 50 years, long enough that women of reproductive age had never lived in a world without it. As the decision triggered state bans and animated voters in the midterms, it shook complacency and forced many people to reconsider their positions.

articles.headline: Reddit’s Chief Says He Wants It to ‘Grow Up.’ Will Its Community Let It?
articles.snippet: As the social media site matures, its users and moderators have made their displeasure about corporate changes known, putting the company into a bind.
articles.abstract: As the social media site matures, its users and moderators have made their displeasure about corporate changes known, putting the company into a bind.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the past 11 years, Bucky has put time and effort into stewarding and guiding dozens of communities on Reddit, the sprawling internet message board.

articles.headline: Chinese Firm Sent Large Shipments of Gunpowder to Russian Munitions Factory
articles.snippet: The previously unreported shipments between a state-owned Chinese company and a Russian munitions factory last year raise new questions about Beijing’s role in Russia’s war against Ukraine.
articles.abstract: The previously unreported shipments between a state-owned Chinese company and a Russian munitions factory last year raise new questions about Beijing’s role in Russia’s war against Ukraine.
articles.lead_paragraph: On two separate occasions last year, railroad cars carrying tens of thousands of kilograms of smokeless powder — enough propellant to collectively make at least 80 million rounds of ammunition — rumbled across the China-Russia border at the remote town of Zabaykalsk.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson and John Ismay

articles.headline: Supreme Court Revives Biden Immigration Guidelines
articles.snippet: The guidelines, setting priorities for which unauthorized immigrants should be detained, were blocked by a federal judge in Texas.
articles.abstract: The guidelines, setting priorities for which unauthorized immigrants should be detained, were blocked by a federal judge in Texas.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court ruled on Friday that the Biden administration could set priorities for which undocumented immigrants to arrest and which to leave alone, rejecting a challenge from two conservative states that pressed for more aggressive enforcement and handing a major victory to President Biden.

articles.headline: Facing Brutal Heat, the Texas Electric Grid Has a New Ally: ‌Solar Power
articles.snippet: The amount of solar energy generated in Texas has grown exponentially. Some Republicans question the state’s increasing reliance on renewable power.
articles.abstract: The amount of solar energy generated in Texas has grown exponentially. Some Republicans question the state’s increasing reliance on renewable power.
articles.lead_paragraph: Strafed by powerful storms and superheated by a dome of hot air, Texas has been enduring a dangerous early heat wave this week that has broken temperature records and strained the state’s independent power grid.

articles.headline: The Super Connector Who Built Sam Bankman-Fried’s Celebrity World
articles.snippet: Michael Kives, a former Hollywood agent, connected FTX’s founder to Katy Perry, Orlando Bloom, Bill Clinton and others. His firm got $700 million in exchange, a lawsuit claims.
articles.abstract: Michael Kives, a former Hollywood agent, connected FTX’s founder to Katy Perry, Orlando Bloom, Bill Clinton and others. His firm got $700 million in exchange, a lawsuit claims.
articles.lead_paragraph: About 10 months before he was arrested on fraud charges, the cryptocurrency mogul Sam Bankman-Fried posed for a photograph at the 2022 Super Bowl in Inglewood, Calif.
articles.byline: By David Yaffe-Bellany and Erin Griffith
